Below are the test cases that should be run when evolution-ews is updated to new major releases in the development version of Ubuntu. These should also be run for all evolution Stable Release Updates.

=== Pre-requisites ===

# Have a Microsoft 365 account
# Remove the `evolution-ews` package if installed, keeping only `evolution-ews-core`
# Install the update
# Log out and log back in (or restart)

=== Add online account ===

# Open the Settings app (gnome-control-center)
# Navigate to "Online Accounts"
# Click "Microsoft 365" under "Connect an Account"
# Click "Sign In..."
# Follow the steps in your web browser to log in
# Return to Settings
# Click "Microsoft 365" under "Your Accounts"
# Ensure that the "Mail", "Calendar" and "Contacts" toggles are enabled

=== Test Case (Calendar) ===

# In your web browser, navigate to https://outlook.live.com/calendar/0/
# Create a new event for today
# Open the Calendar app (gnome-calendar)
# Hit F5 to synchronize the remote calendars
# Verify that event you created is visible
# Select the event
# Modify the event title and schedule
# Verify that the event was updated in the Calendar app
# Verify that the event was updated in https://outlook.live.com/calendar/0/
# Select the event again
# Delete the event
# Verify that the event is no longer visible in the Calendar app
# Verify that the event is no longer visible in https://outlook.live.com/calendar/0/

=== Optional Test Case (Contacts) ===

# In your web browser, navigate to https://outlook.live.com/people/0/
# Create a new contact
# Open the Contacts app (gnome-contacts)
# Verify that the contact you created is visible
# Select the contact
# Modify the contact information
# Verify that the contact information was updated in the Contacts app
# Verify that the contact information was updated in https://outlook.live.com/people/0/
# Select the contact again
# Delete the contact
# Verify that the contact is no longer visible in the Contacts app
# Verify that the contact is no longer visible in https://outlook.live.com/people/0/

=== Optional Test Case (Email) ===

# Send an email to your Microsoft 365 address
# Open the Evolution app
# Select the "Mail" view, from the bottom-right menu
# Verify that you can see the email in your inbox
# Click "New" From the top-left corner
# Write an email to another email address of yours
# Verify that you received the email
